intro: Gelidocalamus multifolius, commonly known as the multileaf cold bamboo, is a unique plant species native to the high-altitude regions of southern China. It is characterized by its slender, cold-tolerant stems and its ability to thrive in harsh, mountainous environments. The plant exhibits a complex morphology, with multiple leaf sheaths and a distinctive, hollow stem structure. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, adapted to reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Gelidocalamus multifolius is of interest to botanists due to its ecological significance and potential for medicinal use.
